Smart pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see improvement in battery life. Note that in some cases it can result in unresponsive areas on touch screen
Save battery by shutting off extra pixels
Shut off pixels to reduce power consumption
Enable Smart Pixels when battery saver is enabled
Prevents burn-in on OLED devices by shifting pixels every so often

Reset battery statistics after reaching user defined charging level

Smart Charging allows you to set maximum charging level to extend the lifespan of your battery. When enabled, battery stops charging at Stop trigger level and resumes charging at Start trigger level. Stop trigger level should be always greater than Start trigger level.
